title: Workspace helps to organize a set of projects sharing common config
text: workspace package propose way organize R project share common configuration (init process). ‘workspace’ root directory containing sub-directories R scripts (potentially many sublevel directories). packages allows scripts run directory (.e. R working directory), allowing resolve relative path location (natural behaviour) access workspace directory way access location outside workspace. shares common features packages like - rprojroot - different approach workspace root identified .Rworkspace file (promote standard layout) .Rworkspace file can contains one several files load launch, allowing setup project workspace level (complementary site/user) also provides paths management functions, allow refer locations outside workspace avoiding manipulate full path.

title: Workspace helps to organize a set of projects sharing common config
text: workspace directory, R scripts organized want subdirectories. use workspace allow script determine root workspace (get files files) run one common setup scripts. create workpace, just create file named “.Rworkspace” root project, containing several subdirectories. ’s also possible use init_workspace() function . use setup feature, put name script load line “.Rworkspace” file. Now can run script subdirectory, launch workspace script use

title: Workspace helps to organize a set of projects sharing common config
text: workspace package proposes way handle external path using path builder. global path builder available (global_out_path()) intending manage case want refer common output directory (example scripts output placed). principle allow scripts refer external location known real location running, relative path used scripts. use , define location computer running script, make runnable another computer (meaning often another location) ’s strongly recommended define place managed versioning system (like git subversion). example, can defined user-specific .Rprofile scripts loaded workspace setup (ignored git/) workspace package loaded, can use my_path() get path inside output path avoid repetition, ’s also possible use suffix common output path
code: options(workspace.outpath="/my/output/path") my_path() # The current output path, -> /my/output/path my_path("myfile") # -> /my/output/path/myfile init_path("subprojet1") # Common output path is now /my/output/path/subproject1 my_path("myfile") # /my/output/path/subproject1/myfile  init_path("subprojet2") # Common output path is now /my/output/path/subproject2 my_path("myfile") # /my/output/path/subproject2/myfile
